title: Toward Responsible Federated Large Language Models: Leveraging a Safety Filter and Constitutional AI
author: Eunchung Noh (Samsung Electronics), Jeonghun Baek (The University of Tokyo), ...
relevance_why: The paper discusses methods for enhancing the safety of large language models, which can be beneficial in contexts like audio captioning and text-to-audio generation by ensuring the generated outputs are safe and non-harmful.
background: Federated learning allows independent clients to collaboratively train a shared model while keeping their data decentralized and private, but poses risks with harmful content potentially degrading model safety.
contribution: This paper introduces the application of a safety filter and constitutional AI to improve safety in federated large language models, achieving over a 20% enhancement in safety metrics.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Prior methods lack robust mechanisms to filter out harmful responses during federated training, potentially leading to unsafe models.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates two established responsible AI methods into the federated framework, significantly enhancing the safety of the output without severely increasing computational costs.

key_innovation: Combines a safety filter and constitutional AI with federated learning to proactively mitigate the risks of harmful content in language model responses.
real_world_impact: Enhancing safety in federated large language models has significant implications for applications in customer service, automated content generation, and any sector relying on AI-driven communications.
limitations: The computational overhead of constitutional AI in every federated learning round is a concern, although a cost-efficient approach has been proposed.

new_terms.federated learning: **Federated learning** is a machine learning technique that allows decentralized training of models by enabling clients to learn from their data without sharing it directly.
new_terms.constitutional AI: **Constitutional AI** involves guiding AI behavior by a set of defined principles or rules, enabling self-critique and adherence to ethical standards.
